Headlights required in daytime: It is mandatory to keep headlights on during the day, even in clear weather conditions. Using a mobile phone while driving: Handheld phone use is strictly prohibited. Use a hands-free system if necessary. Alcohol limit: The blood alcohol limit is 0.05% (lower for new drivers at 0.01%). Police conduct frequent roadside checks, and penalties for DUI are severe. Priority from the right: Unless otherwise marked, vehicles coming from the right have priority at intersections. Pedestrian crossings: Pedestrians always have the right of way at zebra crossings. Drivers must stop if a pedestrian intends to cross. Important traffic signs Swiss roads are well-marked, but if you're unfamiliar with the country's traffic signs, it can be easy to get confused. Understanding these essential signs will help you navigate safely and ensure you follow local driving regulations.
